item.title: Version 1.2.6
item.description:
Some minor performance enhancements and a growl update. Mostly just playing around with dtrace.

  • Updated Growl
  • Disabled growl notification for polling
  • Reduce system calls by remembering

item.title: Version 1.2.5
item.description: Minor fix for something that was showing up in the logs under Leopard.

item.title: Version 1.2.4
item.description:
AppHider now manages login items for you so once you can get used to it you can be sure that it'll always be there for you.

By default, it will automatically add itself to login items the first time it runs after having not tried. After this, you can remove it from login items either via AppHider preferences or system preferences.

item.title: Version 1.2.3
item.description:
Applications may now be relaunched from the app quit growl notification.

This notification isn't delivered by default, but I've been using it just to have more stuff scrolling about my screen. After accidentally closing an application today and having it point out that I'd done so, it seemed like an obvious enhancement.

item.title: Version 1.2.2
item.description:
I got rid of some annoying and unnecessary logging and added a bit more proactive memory cleanup.

I also realize I'd completely broken the periodic update mechanism by configuring it with a string in the plist instead of a numeric type. Probably should've tried that once before letting anyone see this.

item.title: Version 1.2.1
item.description:
I figured it'd be a good idea to have checks automatically scheduled to run periodically since this app should basically always be running.

In the meantime, checks are hard-coded to once every two hours. At some point I make a preference for this. Luckily, you'll get it automatically since it's scheduled to update itself.

item.title: Version 1.2
item.description: This release officially supports sparkle for software updates.
